ImageFunction.doBoxBlur

Function/Meaning
Apply box blur
Type
Method of the ImageFunction class
Syntax
doBoxBlur(bmp, xblur=1, yblur=1, cliprect=null, isalpha=true)
Arguments
bmp Specifies the Bitmap object to apply the box blur to.
xblur Specifies the horizontal blur range.
yblur Specifies the vertical blur range.
cliprect Specifies the clipping region as a Rect object (in Bitmap image coordinates).
If unspecified, the entire image is targeted.
isalpha Specifies whether to process the alpha channel.
Return Value
None (void)
Description
Applies a blur effect. The algorithm used is "box blur".
Box blur calculates the average luminance of pixels within a "range" defined by the two parameters xblur and yblur. For example, if xblur=10 and yblur=2, the average luminance of pixels in a rectangular range of -10 to 10 horizontally and -2 to 2 vertically around the target pixel is calculated, and that becomes the final luminance for that pixel.
The area of the range can be calculated as (xblur*2+1) * (yblur*2+1). In the current version, if this area is less than 256, a faster algorithm is used compared to when the area is 256 or more.
If isalpha is true, a special algorithm for alpha blending is used, which is slightly slower.
If false, a faster algorithm is used.
